qas.question: What period did the amount of ethnic Estonians drop by 61%?
What trend caused the drop of ethnic Estonians?

answers.text: mass immigration of urban industrial workers from Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus

qas.question: Who ordered large scales of deportations and executions?
What year did minorities in Estonia make up more than a third of the country?

context: <a0_0>Between 1945 and 1989<a0_0/>, the share of ethnic Estonians in the population resident within the currently defined boundaries of Estonia dropped to 61%, caused primarily by the Soviet programme promoting <a1_0>mass immigration of urban industrial workers from Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus<a1_0/>, as well as by wartime emigration and <a2_0>Joseph Stalin<a2_0/>'s mass deportations and executions.[citation needed] By <a3_0>1989<a3_0/>, minorities constituted more than one-third of the population, as the number of non-Estonians had grown almost fivefold.
